name: Model Component Registration
description: Register a model component and its grid configuration
title: [EMD] Model Component:

field_guidance.component:
**Component types defined by EMD:**

- **aerosol**: Atmospheric aerosols (dust, sulfate, organic, etc.)
- **atmosphere**: Atmospheric circulation and thermodynamics
- **atmospheric-chemistry**: Gas-phase and aqueous chemistry in atmosphere
- **land-ice**: Ice sheets and glaciers
- **land-surface**: Soil, vegetation, snow, hydrology
- **ocean**: Ocean circulation and thermodynamics
- **ocean-biogeochemistry**: Marine carbon cycle and ecosystems
- **sea-ice**: Sea ice dynamics and thermodynamics

This determines the domain prefix for your component_config ID.
field_guidance.name:
**Naming conventions:**

**If component has common name:**
- Use official name with version: 'ARPEGE-Climat Version 6.3', 'NEMO v3.6', 'CLM5'

**If embedded with no common name:**
- Format: [HostComponentName]-[component_type]
- Example: 'HadAM3-aerosol', 'CESM2-chemistry'

**Consistency:**
- Use consistent capitalization
- Include version numbers
- Match official documentation
field_guidance.family:
**Component family:**

Components in a family share code base but may differ in:
- Resolution
- Parameter choices
- Physics options
- Coupling configurations

**Examples:**
- Family: 'NEMO' → Members: 'NEMO v3.6', 'NEMO v4.0', 'NEMO v4.2'
- Family: 'CAM' → Members: 'CAM5', 'CAM6', 'CAM7'
- Family: 'ARPEGE-Climat' → Members: 'ARPEGE-Climat v6.1', 'v6.3'

**Leave as 'Not applicable' if:**
- First/only version of component
- No family grouping exists
field_guidance.description:
**What to include:**

1. **Component purpose**: What processes does it simulate?
2. **Key physics**: Main parameterizations or physics packages
3. **Scope**: Domain and processes covered
4. **Version info**: What's new or distinctive about this version

**Examples:**

'ARPEGE-Climat Version 6.3 simulates atmospheric circulation using spectral dynamics with semi-Lagrangian advection. Includes comprehensive physics for radiation, convection, clouds, and boundary layer processes.'

'NEMO v3.6 ocean model with OPA dynamics, LIM2 sea ice coupling interface, and z-coordinate vertical discretization. Includes tidal mixing and improved overflow parameterizations.'

**Keep it high-level** - detailed physics goes in publications (provide DOIs below).
field_guidance.horizontal_computational_grid:
**Grid ID format:** c### (e.g., c100, c101)

**You received this ID** when you submitted your Horizontal Computational Grid issue.

**If you don't have one yet:**
1. First submit Grid Cells and Subgrid issue → get s### IDs
2. Then submit Horizontal Computational Grid issue → get c### ID
3. Then come back to this form

**Leave blank if:**
- Component has no horizontal dimension (e.g., 1D column models)
- Will register grid later

**Check existing grids:** Browse https://emd.mipcvs.dev/horizontal_computational_grid/
field_guidance.vertical_computational_grid:
**Grid ID format:** v### (e.g., v100, v103)

**You received this ID** when you submitted your Vertical Computational Grid issue.

**If you don't have one yet:**
1. Submit Vertical Computational Grid issue → get v### ID
2. Then come back to this form

**Leave blank if:**
- Component has no vertical dimension (e.g., 2D surface models)
- Will register grid later

**Check existing grids:** Browse https://emd.mipcvs.dev/vertical_computational_grid/
field_guidance.code_base:
**Preferred format:**
- **GitHub/GitLab URL** pointing to specific tag/commit
  - Example: https://github.com/NEMO-ocean/NEMO/tree/4.0.6
  - Example: https://gitlab.com/project/repo/-/tree/v2.1

**If public but no version URL:**
- Provide main repository URL

**If not public:**
- Enter 'private'

**If not available:**
- Leave blank

**DOI preferred if available:**
- Example: https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.1234567
field_guidance.reference_dois:
**Enter one DOI URL per line:**

```
https://doi.org/10.1029/2020MS002075
https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-12-1087-2019
```

**Find DOIs:**
- Model description papers
- Component-specific publications
- Technical documentation with DOI

**Format requirements:**
- Must start with 'https://doi.org/'
- One per line
- No other text

**At least one required** - this helps users understand your component!
